physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Splenomegaly (17.5 cm), liver: heterogeneous with nodular margin and large regenerative nodule (5.7 cm), esophageal varices (grade 2).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient experienced several episodes of hematemesis requiring sclerotherapy and banding of esophageal varices, leading to bedridden status due to fatigue, gross ascites, spontaneous bleeding, and intractable pruritus.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Postoperative complications included small perihepatic hematoma and consolidation in the left lower lobe of the lung.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By day 10 post-liver transplantation, the graft was functioning satisfactorily with no evidence of acute cellular rejection.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Liver biopsy showed minor degree of nonspecific portal inflammation.
Abnormal liver-function tests prompted a liver biopsy demonstrating mild cholangiolitic changes, with no evidence of cellular rejection.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Levels of aspartate aminotransferase returned to normal, but levels of γ-glutamyltransferase remained elevated, leading to another biopsy three weeks later that showed mild focal injury of the bile ducts.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Hemoglobin: 12.3 g/L; white cell count: 6500 cells/mm³; neutrophils: 2740 cells/mm³; platelets: 156,000 cells/mm³; international normalized prothrombin ratio: 1.0; bilirubin: 0.6 mg/dL (10 µmol/L); aspartate aminotransferase: 39 U/L; γ-glutamyltransferase: 52 U/L; albumin: 3.5 g/dL.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient in excellent health with satisfactory function of both grafts.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's overall health improved significantly post-transplantation.
